pullRequest.body:
This PR proves the order isomorphism between blocks containing a point and subgroups containing its stabilizer.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

This is a new branch to correct the bad merge of #12050

:v: AntoineChambert-Loir can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9889587082/job/27315986823)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9889587082/job/27315987569)
bors d+
bors d+
Why is this primed? Did you want to call it `isBlock_orbit'`?

Because there used to be `IsBlock.of_orbit` which says `IsBlock G (MulAction.orbit G a)` (so with H = top), and I don't remember why that theorem is not in this PR. (That may be a bug of me splitting one file into 5 PR).
Isn't that theorem called `isBlock_orbit`?

You're right. Here is why I'm confused. I am tempted to use dot notation, and since that applies to `IsBlock` property, to keep the `IsBlock` namespace. But sometimes my good intentions don't work as well.
So `isBlock_orbit'` should at least be consistent with the first one.
I changed the name to `IsBlock.of_orbit`.

```suggestion
    exact ⟨⟨k, hB.def_mem ha hx⟩, rfl⟩
```

```suggestion
theorem stabilizer_orbit_eq {a : X} {H : Subgroup G} (hH : stabilizer G a ≤ H) :
```
Either move line 416 to line 415, or move `{a : X} (ha : a ∈ B)` to line 416.

```suggestion
theorem IsBlock.stabilizer_le {B : Set X} (hB : IsBlock G B) {a : X} (ha : a ∈ B) :
```

```suggestion
/-- The orbit of `a` under a subgroup containing the stabilizer of `a` is a block -/
```
(As you see, I have a not so wide screen and I'm a very 80 column guy… I'll follow your recommendations anyway.)
Ah, that makes sense :)

```suggestion
/-- If `B` is a block containing `a`, then the stabilizer of `B` contains the stabilizer of `a` -/
```

```suggestion
/-- A block is the orbit of `a` under its stabilizer -/
```

```suggestion
/-- Order equivalence between blocks in `X` containing a point `a`
 and subgroups of `G` containing the stabilizer of `a` (Wielandt, th. 7.5)-/
```

Does this work?
```suggestion
    rintro ⟨B, ha, hB⟩ ⟨B', ha', hB'⟩
```
